reader

Interface ExcelReader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConcreteReader

    public interface ExcelReader
    The interface that represents a reader from an excel file. The file is assumed to have the next format: First column: Date of buy. Second column: amount of twenty canisters bought. Third column: amount of twelve canisters bought. Forth column: total price of the buy. Fifth column: total amount of money paid. Sixth column: customer's balance on the date. Seventh column: amount of returned twenty canisters. Eighth column: balance of twenty canisters. Ninth column: amount of returned twelve canisters. Tenth column: balance of twelve canisters. Eleventh column: total balance of canisters.
    Author:
    Guido Chia

    • Method Detail

      • readInfo

        OutputInfo readInfo(java.io.File customerFile)
             throws WorkbookException
        Reads the info of the given file, and stores it in an OutputInfo object.
        Parameters:
        customerFile - the file of the customer.
        Returns:
        OutputInfo containing the info read from the excel.
        Throws:
        WorkbookException - if the file doesn't exist, or it's not available.

      • readCostumersMonth

        java.util.Collection<Customer> readCostumersMonth(java.util.Date[] months,
                                                  java.io.File directory)
        Reads all the costumers from the given directory, and creates Customer objects for them, with the info of the given dates.
        Parameters:
        months - Dates from the months that wants to be read. The day here will be ignored
        directory - Directory in which the customer's folder will be
        Returns:
        Collection of Customer that bought anything in the given month and year
